org.gearman
Interface GearmanFunction

public interface GearmanFunction

A GearmanFunction provides the interface to creates function that can be executed by the GearmanWorker.

Author:
isaiah

Method Summary
Modifier and Type Method and Description
 GearmanJobResult work(GearmanJob job)
          The implementation of a gearman function.
 

Method Detail

work

GearmanJobResult work(GearmanJob job)
The implementation of a gearman function. A GearmanFunction is registered with a GearmanWorker to let it know when a job for this function come in, to execute this method.

If a runtime exception is thrown while executing the function. The job is automatically put into the "completed" state and a FAIL response is returned to the client.

If a null value is returned, it is assumed the execution was successful but no data is to be sent back to the client.

Once this method has returned, the GearmanJob parameter is put into a "completed" state, any attempt to use the callback methods after the job has been put into this state, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

Parameters:
job -
The GearmanJob provides information needed to run the function. It also provides callback functionality, allowing the function to send data back to the client while the job is running.

It is important to know that once the function has finished, the GearmanJob is considered "completed" and the callback functionality is no longer valid. Any attempt to send callback data once in the completed state, and IllegalStateException is thrown
Returns:
Once this method has returned, the state of the job is "completed" and the result is forwarded to the client. A return value of null implies a successful execution with no data to return.
